Conditional Formatting for JIRA Dashboards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61990].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Unable to Release *and* Archive a version in a single REST call

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a version in JIRA
# Make sure this version is NOT released and NOT archived
# Referring to [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/version-getVersion], run the following REST call using the {{PUT}} method with the below data: [http://localhost:8080/jira/rest/api/2/version/10000]
{code:java}
{
     "self": "http://localhost:8080/jira/rest/api/2/version/10000",
     "id": "10000",
     "description": "An excellent version",
     "name": "New Version 1",
     "archived": true,
     "released": true,
     "releaseDate": "2010-07-06",
     "overdue": false,
     "projectId": 10000
 }{code}

h3. Expected Results
# The details of the version is updated with the new values and is also Archived *and* Released

h3. Actual Results
# The details of the version is updated with the new values but is *only* released. It is not being archived. The following is the response
{code:java}
{
   "self": "http://localhost:8080/jira/rest/api/2/version/10000",
   "id": "10000",
   "description": "An excellent version",
   "name": "New Version 1",
   "archived": false,
   "released": true,
   "releaseDate": "2010-07-06",
   "userReleaseDate": "06/Jul/10",
   "projectId": 10000
 }{code}
# Running the *same* call again will archive the version

h3. Notes
# The same happens when unreleasing and unarchiving in a single rest call
#* The first call will unrelease it
#* The second call will unarchive it
# Does *not* happen in JIRA 6.4.12
 
h3. Workaround
Archive and Release the version in 2 separate REST calls
fields.summary: Unable to Release and Archive a Version in a single REST API Call
Create traceability of all Stories  to Test cases.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Logging in to JIRA with {{<baseURL/login.jsp}} will redirect the user to the configured home page, however logins with {{<baseURL>}} or {{<baseURL>/secure/MyJiraHome.jspa}} will not redirect user to the configured home page.


h3. Environment
Firefox
Chrome


h3. Steps to reproduce
{panel:title=Scenario 1> If you log in with the base URL}
 # Log in to JIRA.
 # Click on the *Profile* icon and choose _Boards_ or _Issue Navigator_ from the drop down list.
 # You will be redirected to the configured home page.
 # Log out from JIRA.
 # In a new tab or a new window, enter JIRA base url in the browser and go, for example {{{color:#205081}localhost:8080.{color}}}
 # You will be redirected to log in to {{{color:#205081}localhost:8080/secure/Dashboard.jspa.{color}}}
 # Enter the correct user name and password to log in.
 # Upon successful login, observe if you will be redirected to the previously configured home page (_Boards_ or _Issue Navigator_) or _Dashboard_ page.{panel}
 
{panel:title=Scenario 2> If you log in with /secure/MyJiraHome.jspa}
 # Make sure you are not already logged in to JIRA.
 # Enter {color:#205081}{{<baseURL>/secure/MyJiraHome.jspa}}{color} and go (i) Clicking on the site logo (top left side of the page, next to the 3 bars menu button) works too
 # You will be redirected to log in to {color:#205081}{{localhost:8080/secure/Dashboard.jspa.}}{color}
 # Enter the correct user name and password to log in.
 # Upon successful login, observe if you will be redirected to the previously configured home page (_Boards_ or _Issue Navigator_) or _Dashboard_ page.{panel}
 

h3. Expected Result
Once logged in, you will be redirected to the previously configured home page (_Boards_ or _Issue Navigator_)


h3. Actual Result
Once logged in, you are not being redirected to the configured home page but stay with the _Dashboard_ page


h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: In Firefox and Chrome, logins with {{<baseURL>}} or {{<baseURL>/secure/MyJiraHome.jspa}} do not redirect the user to the configured home page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61987].
  {panel}

h3. Description

When JIRA sends a filter subscription email to an user with a Microsoft Exchange mail account, the issue status field is not rendered correctly and renders HTML markup in the email.
h3. Step to Reproduce
 # Configure an outgoing mail server
 # Create a filter
 # A user with a Microsoft Exchange mail account subscribes to the filter
 # Wait for JIRA to send the filter subscription mail
 # Open mail with outlook or online browser OWA

h3. Expected result

!image-2016-07-21-18-16-58-095.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Result

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
Filter subscription email is only broken for specific affected mail servers (e.g. exchance, mail.ru), other mail servers like gmail are unaffected.

 
h3. Workaround
* Change the email format from HTML to Text.
* Check if the affected mail server has advanced settings that allow you to configure HTML rendering, and see if settings can be tweaked to avoid modifying or simplifying the HTML source in such a way that it breaks.

h3. Notes
* JIRA 6.4.x filter subscription mails don't exibit this bug
* Problem seems to be related to the way the different mail servers try to simplify some complex html tags in the email source for rendering.
*Update*
* Similar issue is reproducible with mail.ru
fields.summary: Mail rendering error in filter subscription email with Microsoft exchange account and Mail.ru

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61986].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Application links can use 2 different URLs: Application URLs and Display URLs

This helps in certain environments where creating the Application Link over proxy/SSL may produce unwanted behaviours or problems.

Subscribing to another applications gadget in similar environment may have problems as well
h3. Suggestion

Have the same option for subscribing to another applications gadget: allow 2 different URLs, one for the back end and another for end-user display.
fields.summary: Allow adding other application gadgets over different URLs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61985].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

In [Getting started with JIRA Core|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER071/Getting+started+with+JIRA+Core] documentation, there's information shown below:

{quote}Project administrators are responsible for configuring their projects.

They can administer projects, change the look and feel, and make various configuration changes to the project. A project administrator can't create a project unless they're explicitly given this permission by an administrator.{quote}

This is bit misleading because this indicates that Project Administrator can create new project if JIRA Administrator gave them specific permission. The fact is, in order for anyone be able to create project in JIRA, they have to be JIRA Administrator.

h3. Suggested Solution

Edit the documentation below:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER071/Getting+started+with+JIRA+Core

Replace the sentence below:

{quote}A project administrator can't create a project unless they're explicitly given this permission by an administrator{quote}

with something more accurate like:

{quote}A project administrator can't create a project unless they're explicitly given JIRA Administrator permission{quote}

h3. Workaround 

-
fields.summary: Change Project Administrator information in documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61984].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When scrolling through an issue, user needs to scroll back up to the header to be able to transition/edit issue and it would be inefficient if there are a lot of comments in an issue.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow issue headers to be pinned when scrolling through an issue.

h3. Workaround
Use the home button to jump to top
fields.summary: Pin Issue header when scrolling
Display name when sending notification mails in text type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61982].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition
At the moment, it is not possible to generate a report on the changes of due date. We can only track the due date change via the issue history. People can avoid their work showing as overdue by just changing the due date value. 

h2. Suggestion
It would be great if JIRA could provide an ability to generate a report on due date changes as one of the criteria.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to have the ability to generate a report on due date changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61981].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , Time Tracking field is stick together , which is "Original Estimate" and "Remaining Estimate" field . Both field can't be configured separately and there's no status rule in order to edit the field . 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide *Edit permission* for  "Original Estimate" and "Remaining Estimate" field based on *Status*
fields.summary: Allow to edit "Original Estimate" and "Remaining Estimate" field based on status

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Worklogs popup doesn't should the time as per the logged-in users timezone. 
 !worklog.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as any user
# Go to his profile and change timezone Eg: GMT +5
# Make sure that JIRA system timezone is different Eg: GMT -8

h3. Expected Results
The current time for the field *Date Started* on the worklog dialog should be shown according to the logged-in users profile preference

h3. Actual Results
The current time for the field *Date Started* on the worklog dialog is shown in JIRA system timezone. Therefore instead of showing the current time in GMT +5 (where the user is from), it shows the current time in GMT -8. 

h3. Notes
Not reproducible in JIRA 6.4.1. Was reproducible in JIRA 7.1.7
fields.summary: Worklog popup doesn't should the current time as per the logged-in users timezone
DOM elements are getting removed in Jira 7.2 RC

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61978].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

After upgrading UPM to the latest version (2.21), the details of JEMH plugin can no longer be displayed correctly in UPM.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the JEMH plugin
 # Upgrade the UPM to 2.21
 # Refresh the *Manage add-ons* page
 # Click JEMH plugin to expand its details

h3. Expected Results

Plugin details being displayed

h3. Actual Results

A HTTP 404 error is displayed in browser console
{code:java}
Failed to load resource: the server https://marketplace.atlassian.com/rest/2/addons/com.javahollic.jira.jemh-ui/pricing/server/live 
responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)
{code}
And the details of the JEMH plugin is not displayed :
!2016-07-20_upm-err.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Using a UPM version 2.20.X
fields.summary: Details of JEMH plugin cannot be displayed correctly in UPM

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61976].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian, I have two queries regarding the decision to remove anonymous view access to Agile boards:

Firstly, can product management please confirm that your product strategy still aligns with your company values; I specifically refer to two quoted company values that seem to, from a customer's perspective, have been ignored in the decision to remove anonymous access of agile boards and your approach to choosing not to communicate such a drastic change:
*"Don’t #@!% the customer"*
"Customers are our lifeblood. Without happy customers, we’re doomed. So considering the customer perspective - collectively, not just a handful - comes first." - Do you believe removing functionality that adversely affects the end user, whilst not communicating the intent before the fact in release notes or otherwise, aligns with this company value? Do you feel you have treat your customers fairly here?

"Open company, no bullshit" - Do you believe that withholding information on drastic product changes in your release notes constitutes an "Open company, no bullshit"?

Secondly, in the spirit of providing solutions and not just pointing out problems, I would like to know how Atlassian would view a community attempt to re-instate this functionality through a free JIRA Core plug-in released on the Atlassian Marketplace. Can you clarify and confirm that if the community does chose to create such a plug-in that allows anonymous users to view issues in a board format, functionality that was present in previous versions, that Atlassian will not remove this plug in from the Atlassian Marketplace?

Thank you for your responses so far and I especially look forward to Atlassian's comment on free community JIRA Core add-ons.
fields.summary: JIRA Core plugin terms & conditions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61975].

[This OnDemand documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Defining+'Priority'+Field+Values] about priorities in JIRA states that the icon for priorities can be placed somewhere in '<jira-application-dir>/images/icons'.

However, this does not seem to be the case. It seems to be impossible to use this directory for uploading images. In the same documentation, it says that local icon files are a restricted function.

A better explanation about how to change the priority icons would help better understand this process. 

Is it only done by uploading the images elsewhere?
fields.summary: Apparently incorrect documentation about priority icons
Jira Admin > Issues > Notification Schemes > Edit Notification Schemes Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61973].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
While it's possible to set up the number of working days within a week, it is not possible to specify which days are workable in JIRA Core. 

In JIRA Software is possible to do that by following the steps at [Configuring working days|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Configuring+working+days], however this is not the case for Core.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the possibility to select which are the working days in the week (see screenshot). 

h3. Workaround 
There's no workaround at the moment. The only option possible at the moment is to set up the number of working days as per [Configure time tracking|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Time+Tracking].
fields.summary: Configure working days in JIRA Core
Allow User to Change "Assignee Dropdown Menu"

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61966].

Ability to create custom fields which automatically calculate their values based on other fields.
For example Field A = Field B * 0.2

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61960].
  {panel}

Add the ability to perform CRUD operations for JIRA release artifacts and build link to the REST API.

The JIRA webpage for a released version contains a link to the bamboo landing page as well as build artifacts in the upper right of the page. These are not available in the REST API

https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/version-getVersion

This feature would help facilitate integration with build systems other than Bamboo Cloud (which is going away).
fields.summary: Add JIRA Release build link and artifacts to REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61959].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Some users with visual disabilities will have to zoom in a significant percentage to be able to work as normal. JIRAs design when zoomed in isn't user friendly and gives users a hard time navigating and working with JIRA with all the pop ups in different pages in JIRA
h3. Suggestion

Improve on JIRAs design for users with visual disabilities. This includes having pop ups appear in less obstructive places.

Even better if users have an option to select in the profile page for those visually impaired. When this option is selected, JIRAs design will switch to a more user friendly interface while magnified at the same time. It should also handle pop up dialogs gracefully (eg. workflow editor when zoomed in, re-index dialog) so that it doesn't consume much UI space
fields.summary: Better design for users with visual disabilities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.summary: Allow the Labels field width to be customizable.
Custom fields: Grouped select list options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61954].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Originates for [SDS Bug ticket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-3653]

After configuring [Receiving request by email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER031/Receiving+requests+by+email] , performing the test in {{Application > Email Request}} returns 'No problems found with email settings configuration.Successfully connected to the specified email server.', however, when click on 'View Log' , nothing is showing in connectivity log tab and processing log tab.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
This can happen if any abrupt interruption occurs towards the database/JIRA itself.
* network issue towards DB


h3. Expected Results
Emails are able to be retrieved by JSD
Scheduled Service should be clever enough to perform a retry

h3. Actual Results
Emails are not able to be retrieved
Scheduled Service are stuck
 
h3. Notes
Looking at the [Scheduled Jobs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshooting-jira-service-desk-incoming-mail-790960076.html#TroubleshootingJIRAServiceDeskIncomingMail-ScheduledJobs], the scheduled jobs seems to hangs and is not running (by referring to 'Next Run' date, compare with the real time of the server. The next run date/time will be backdated)
 !Selection_267.png|thumbnail! 

A Number of Root Cause investigation based on the error:
Fixing below issue can help to solve the issue as well (as a workaround)
{code}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, JOB_ID, JOB_RUNNER_KEY, SCHED_TYPE, INTERVAL_MILLIS, FIRST_RUN, CRON_EXPRESSION, TIME_ZONE, NEXT_RUN, VERSION, PARAMETERS FROM public.clusteredjob WHERE JOB_ID=? (FATAL: terminating connection due to administrator command)
{code}
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Unable to establish a connection with the database. (IO Error: The Network Adapter could not establish the connection)
{code}
* This is due to DB is restarted/lost connection temporarily and JIRA was not restart together afterwards

{code}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Unable to establish a connection with the database. (Unknown server host name 'xxx.yyy.corp.com'.)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.getConnection(SQLProcessor.java:399)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.prepareStatement(SQLProcessor.java:543)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.createEntityListIterator(GenericDAO.java:960)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectListIteratorByCondition(GenericDAO.java:883)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.findListIteratorByCondition(GenericHelperDAO.java:194)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:398)
{code}
* There are DNS/routing/network issue from JIRA to Database

h3.Workaround
*Restart JIRA*
fields.summary: Scheduled Jobs Unresponsive/Hangs e.g. mail handlers stop processing emails to create issues due to database connectivity interuptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61950].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The issue collectors (aka feedback dialogs) for JIRA Portfolio, BitBucket Server, and EAC are not showing up.

The cause is that the issue collector JavaScript file (e.g. https://jira.atlassian.com/s/ce8887042eec4829b88083dad08ebd92-T/en_UKp1nl25/70107/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/2.0.9/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:issuecollector/com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:issuecollector.js?locale=en-UK&collectorId=7007d406) is being cached and the old version of the resource is being returned. 

h3. Workaround

Clearing the browser cache or a hard refresh of the page fixes the issue.
fields.summary: Issue collector is not showing up
user_updated webhook should get triggered when user's groups get changed
Clarify handling spaces in setting JAVA_HOME Windows environment variable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61946].
  {panel}

*Background* 
The JIRA username field has different valid characters than the email field. This creates an unfriendly situation when you add a customer in JSD. When you invite/add a new customer to JSD from the customers page, JSD creates the user using the email address as a username. If you invite/add the new customer from User Management, you can choose a different username.

*Scenario*
1. In JSD project Customers page, Agent invites/adds customer using an email address that contains characters that are not valid in the username field (e.g. &). JSD tries to use the email address as the username, and can't because the username field does not allow &.
2. Dialog throws the following err: Email address contains characters that aren’t valid in the username. Add the user, then use the username to add the user to the project. (Add the user is a CTA to User Management)
3. User has to go to UM, add the user, then go back to the project & invite the user using the username instead of the email.

This is confusing & also a pain because you have to leave your task, to go UM, then go back to your task.
fields.summary: JIRA username and email fields have different valid characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61945].
  {panel}

*Experienced Behavior*

When attempting to add a dashboard gadget, the "add a gadget" window no longer automatically loads all of the standard JIRA gadgets. An info box "More Gadgets Available" shows and the link "Load all gadgets" causes the missing gadgets to be loaded.

*Expected Behavior*

Standard JIRA gadgets appear by default.
 * This was the behavior in JIRA 6.4.13

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Install JIRA
 ** Tested in 7.0.0, 7.1.7, 7.1.8, 7.2.0-RC, 7.2.12, 7.7.1
 # Add Dashboard
 # Attempt to add new gadget
 ** Notice that only the "Introduction" gadget appears by default

Screenshot showing current behavior
 !Gadget2.PNG|thumbnail!

Screenshot showing past behavior (JIRA 6.4.8)
 !Gadget.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add a gadget no longer loads all standard JIRA gadgets by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61944].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When creating multiple issues in JIRA and using the 'Create Another' tick box, the first issue created will be ranked under the issue that is highlighted in the backlog. Subsequent tickets within the creation sequence will end up at the bottom of the backlog

h3. Environment
Cloud
Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a JIRA Software project
# Highlight an existing ticket in the backlog
# Click 'Create'
# Make sure the 'Create Another' tick box is selected
# Create multiple tickets
# Check the ranking of the issues

h3. Expected Results
All of the new issues should be created with the lowest rank (bottom of the backlog)

h3. Actual Results
The first issue created is ranked immediately under the issue that was highlighted
All subsequent issues that were created in the series end up ranked at the bottom of the backlog
 
h3.Workaround
When creating issues in the backlog, ensure you have the last issue in the backlog highlighted (issue at the very bottom)
fields.summary: Rank all issues created using 'Create Another' tickbox at the bottom of the backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61943].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The document:

*Set password requirements*
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Set+password+requirements

does not provide examples that are thorough enough for end users. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into a Cloud instance
# Go to User Management
# Click on Password Policy
# Change the password policy to Strong in this example

h3. Expected Results
Based on the example given in the above referenced documentation, the password requirements appear to be:

- Eight characters
- Two special characters
- No capital letters


h3. Actual Results
In testing it was found that the example given does in fact meet the requirements however, typing something other than this for example: 

{{jnmpli2!@}}

The above referenced password meets the requirements as well at the minimum level but this has nine characters. When removing one of the characters from this pattern, JIRA indicates it does not meeting the 'Strong' requirement.

Changing this example to: {{JNmpli2!@!2}} meets the requirements.
 
h3. Notes
It would be extremely helpful if the documentation included 'exact' examples on how passwords should look / their requirements.
fields.summary: Current password requirements are not clear based on security level chosen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61942].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
High number of total project roles can lead to performance problems in JIRA. Normally it's expected to have up to 100 projects roles totally. _getShareTypeEditor_ method has multiplying _AllProjects_ * _AllRoles_ complexity.

h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce the setting jira.project.role.max set to *500*. Use this new setting to limit the number of total project roles that can be created
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to able to limit number of total Project roles created
Can "Issue" terminology be changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
By default, JIRA creates users automatically during the project import process, and these are set to active regardless of the previous state.

h3. Expected Behavior
Create users automatically, but preserve the state from source.

h3. Actual Behavior
Users are created and set to active, possibly causing an overflow in licensed users and also sending notifications of new user created through e-mail.

h3. Workaround
Deactivate users manually under *Administration > User management > Users*. The list of users created should be generated on the pre-import summary (see below).

!view_users_pimport.png|thumbnail!

This can be performed through the database as well, by updating the {{active}} column of the {{cwd_user}} table. Setting the value to 0 will deactivate the user.
fields.summary: Project Import sets automatically created users to "active"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The @mention feature of JIRA is failing to find some users (mostly ones with names starting with the initial letter of the domain) because the javascript responsible for this feature performs a filter over the results of a query via a REST call which is limited to 10 results. The REST call returns users which match the query string (username parameter in the rest call) based on if it exists in EITHER the username, display name, or email address. Because normally the domain matches many users email address, searching for users starting with the initial letter of the domain, will be filtered out. 
e.g: mike@mydomain.com may be filtered out when searching for m if there are many more users with @mydomain.com email address and at least 10 users alphabetically before mike.

h3. Notes

This bug is only affecting the "Description" field.

h3. Environment
Affected version: JIRA Server 7.1.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 11 users with the same domain email address. eg: @example.com
# Name the first 10 users with Letters before e
# Name the 11th user 'example'
# Create an issue and try to mention the user on the "description" field.

h3. Expected Results
If you use the complete username, or display name, the user should always appear.

h3. Actual Results
Using the complete username or display name, doesn't show the user because the rest api is returning 10 previous users (but not displaying them as options)

h3. Workaround
*Partial workaround*
Try with a different user value (if you tried with username, try display name, or last name). The last name value works particularly well as it is quite unique.

*Confirmed workaround*
Typing the first few characters of a user's name and hitting the {{TAB}} button will autocomplete and allow for the user to be mentioned (until you refresh the page) _e.g. John = Joh...{{TAB}}_
fields.summary: Some JIRA '@mentions' are not showing all users on the Description field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61938].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition 
Users would like the ability to move parent issue to *DONE* state automatically, once all it's sub-tasks have been moved to *DONE*. This is currently *only* achievable using various *Third Party Plugins.* 

h3. Suggested Solution
A trigger or a post function in the workflow, that could possibly *Resolve* the parent issue once all sub-tasks are resolved.
fields.summary: Ability to resolve a parent issue once all it's sub-tasks are resolved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61937].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Atlassian HTTP Client's callbacks' ThreadPoolExecutor doesn't queue callbacks, so it might reject tasks submitted to it during high load (when no threads available right at the moment of submitting a task). 
In such cases it throws {{java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException}} from the {{execute}} method in a submitting thread.
Apache HTTP Client doesn't expect that, so it throws {{org.apache.http.nio.reactor.IOReactorException}} when catching {{RejectedExecutionException}} and changes IOReactor status to STOPPED therefore preventing further requests being sent by this client bean.
One of the consequences is that WebHooks stop working after it happens.
h3. Environment

Any JIRA up to 7.2.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable DEBUG logging for {{com.atlassian.httpclient}}
 # Set up an HTTP endpoint (preferably having a timeout of 30+ sec before responding)
 # Configure a WebHook against it
 # Make a bulk edit of 1000 issues
 # Cross the fingers
 # Repeat bulk edits until you see {{java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException}} in the logs.

h3. Expected Results
 - No {{java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException}} thrown
 - No {{org.apache.http.nio.reactor.IOReactorException}} thrown
 - All JIRA's outgoing HTTP requests (including webhooks) continue working

h3. Actual Results
 - Apache HTTP client's reactor status is STOPPED
 - Webhooks (as well as some other functionality) do not work

h3. Workaround

That might only *decrease the probability* of this issue, but not fix it completely:
 - Decrease the number of webhooks
 - Decrease the number of errors when calling webhooks (e.g. get rid of webhooks often throwing TimeoutExceptions, etc.)
 - Better hardware might also help *slightly*

Actions that help if the issue actually happened:
 - Disabling/enabling the Atlassian HTTP Client plugin
 *OR*
 - Restarting JIRA.

Note:
 - Disabling/enabling the Atlassian HTTP Client Plugin will trigger other plugins to be restarted. Schedule downtime to make sure it is not affecting users that using JIRA.
 - Disabling/enabling the Atlassian HTTP Client Plugin will disable other Jira apps (Jira Software, Jira Service Desk). You need to reenable them manually from _Administrations > Add-ons > Manage add-ons_ after that.
fields.summary: Atlassian HTTP client might stop working at high load

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61936].
  {panel}

Java 7 v51 has been updated on my PC and created an issue in Jira (v4.1.1#522) in IE8. 

Attaching a sceeshot through More actions tab in the created issue redirects me to oracle web page.

Does all versions of Jira supports Java7 v51 or any particular? Or any security settings need to be changed?

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Attaching sceenshot through More Actions tab redirects me to oracle page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61935].
  {panel}

Hallo,

Ich habe am letzten Mittwoch mein Account selber erstellt und dann habe ich eine Bestätigungsemail bekommen. Laut diese ist mein User „yoanats“. 

Leider habe ich keinen Zugriff auf das was ich brauche. Und zwar - ich kann mich in JIRA einloggen, aber wenn ich auf „Create Issue“ clicke, muss ich als Project „ Mobile Portal Mkt Request“ auswählen. Mir wird aber diese Option überhaupt nicht gezeigt. Das Gleiche passiert mit Issue Type- ich muss als Issue Type „Content“ auswählen. Leider sehe ich diese Option nicht. Woran kann es liegen? Laut Christian Seifert habe ich Zugriff auf MPI und PORCONIN. 

Kannst du mir weiterhelfen?

Danke schön und VG
Yoana
fields.summary: Habe ich alle Zugänge?
Improve plugin description
How to define notification events when Java VM memory thresholds are breached
As of 5.2, the project admin tab 'People' has changed to 'Roles'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61931].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

Currently we have little information about conditions, validators and post-functions in [our documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Workflow#ConfiguringWorkflow-Advanced_transitionsAdvancedtransitionconfiguration]. If there is a problem being caused by a validator or a condition and the customer is not aware of this configuration in his workflow, it may be problematic to find the issue.

h3. Expected behaviour

The JIRA Admin Helper tool could include a workflow verification step so we could avoid customer's effort to find the problem.
fields.summary: Include workflow validation in JIRA Admin Helper
Remove changes made on issues
single email doesn't work.
Create admin page for "Where is my field?"
Add "Where is my field?" link to transition screens
Convert issue picker to single select

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61901].
  {panel}

JIRA Admin Helper is bundled with JIRA 5.2.
I did a test upgrade from JIRA 5.2.6 to JIRA 6.0.5 and found a bug in JIRA Admin Helper. 

I had problems with the Assignee field and 'Where is my field' suggested that I should have a look at 'Permissions' and 'People'. In JIRA 6, the tab is now called Roles, not People, which made the link point to an error page saying that there are no page called 'People'.

I saw that JIRA Admin Helper is only supported for 5.2.11, but isn't it weird that a system plugin is not compatible when upgrading to a stable JIRA version? 
Is there more System Plugins which may be incompatible in JIRA 6.0.5?

Best regards
Christoffer Karlsson
fields.summary: 'Where is my field' links to 'People' instead if 'Roles'
Can not change jira logo, favicon and L&F
Realy Funny Message in German
Last week most active

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61896].
  {panel}

Problem:

 

When uses an statement like:

 

I don't want to

\{break}

the line

 

What we expect as a results it is exactly the same, although this is the results that we get:

I don't want to

\{break}

 

the line

 

JIRA jumps one line when there is a value between the curly braces, so we're not able to use it in the desired format. I believe that this happens due to the fact that curly braces are used to insert code pieces and format the text in JIRA

 

Expected:

 

To implement a feature on JIRA to escape the Curly braces to be able to use it in texts without breaking the line.
fields.summary: Curly Braces breaks the line

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61895].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The {{Labels}} field can be hidden from a screen via the 'Hide' option in the Field Configuration, and removed from Screen(s) as per [Specifying field behavior|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/specifying-field-behavior-802592555.html#Specifyingfieldbehavior-hidefield] and [Deleting a Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/defining-a-screen-802592587.html#Definingascreen-Configuringascreen'stabsandfields]. However, the {{Labels}} field is still accessible via _More_ > _Labels_.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow a field to be completely hidden from a screen if it's being removed from the Screen(s) and hidden via Field Configuration
h3. Workaround

To remove the {{Labels}} field from the _More_ menu, users may go to:
 # JIRA ADMINISTRATION > Add-ons
 # Manage Add-ons
 # Search for "System add-ons" by typing *Issue Operations Plugin*
 # Expand the add-on
 # Expand the *modules*
 # Disable *View Issue Ops Bar Labels Link*
 (on) Disabling module as per mentioned above will cause the {{Labels}} field to be removed from ALL issues.
fields.summary: The Labels field is still accessible via More menu even though it has been removed from a screen and hidden via Field Configuration
Order sprints by name using JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61893].
  {panel}

When priority is set on ticket, it is set as 'high', 'highest'...
When showing priority in columnar view, it is shown as colored arrows.


This may be saving space on screen, but as a user, it is forcing me to interpret colors.
I find it that it's extra efforts for me to translate these colors to priorities especially.

Priority is important field and should be displayed including TEXT instead of dropping text and just how colored arrows.  

Orange and Red are too close  for 'hightest priority' tckets to stand out
fields.summary: Ticket priority is shown as just arrows (words missing)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61891].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 15 August 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi Everyone,

Thank you for commenting and watching this post over the last few weeks. We have read your comments and recognise the inconvenience that this bug may have caused since its initial occurrence.
h4. What went wrong?

JIRA’s feature for exporting issues as an Excel file (.xls) works by creating an HTML file and saving it with an .xls suffix. Up until recently, this solution worked. However, a recent Microsoft Office security update ([Microsoft Security Bulletin MS16-088 - Critical|https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/security/ms16-088.aspx]) now prevents these files from being opened if the user has a high security setting in place, as the change of the file extension is considered to be a security vulnerability.
h4. What are we doing about this?

We don't believe that our HTML-based Excel export option is the best solution anymore, however we appreciate that many of you have built processes around it and its immediate removal may disrupt your daily operations. The HTML-based Excel export option will, for now, remain in JIRA Cloud.

This feature will be removed for Server in JIRA 7.2.

+Our intention is to eventually deprecate the HTML-based Excel export option in JIRA Cloud also.+ We will announce this prior to the removal. In the meantime, +we will change the .xls suffix to .html to reinforce that it isn't a native Excel file, and to make it easier to open it in web browsers.+ The exported .html file will also still be readable in Excel, if you have configured your environment appropriately (e.g. [Plan Trusted Locations settings for Office 2010|https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc179039(v=office.14).aspx]).

Recently, a new CSV-based Excel export option was released to JIRA Cloud, and will be in JIRA Server 7.2. +We recommend you switch to this export option in the long term.+
h4. Will we develop a native Excel export option?

We are unlikely to provide a native Excel export in the foreseeable future. Having said that, [there are many add-ons in the Atlassian Marketplace that provide this functionality|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=jira&category=&cost=&hosting=&marketingLabel=&q=Excel].

Thanks for your patience and understanding.

Kind Regards,
Kerrod Williams
JIRA Product Management
{panel}
h3. Summary

After a Microsoft update (described below) export Excel sheets can not be done. Excel opens up to a gray window.

Update
{code:java}
***************
Security Update for Microsoft Excel 2010 (KB3115322) 64-Bit Edition
Installation date: ‎7/‎13/‎2016 10:28 PM
Installation status: Successful
Update type: Important
A security vulnerability exists in Microsoft Excel 2010 64-Bit Edition that could allow arbitrary code to run when a maliciously modified file is opened. This update resolves that vulnerability.
More information: 
http://support.microsoft.com/kb/3115322
Help and Support: 
http://support.microsoft.com/?LN=en-us
***************{code}
Windows update did an excel change for security issues.
When the MS update is applied the warning about invalid format is not present and it opens to the blank Excel window.
When the update is rolled back, the export works once again. A warning message "Invalid Extension.jpg" is thrown and the export opens up successfully.
h3. Environment

Cloud - JIRA v1000.148.3
Microsoft Excel 2010
Microsoft Excel 2016 version 16.0.7070.2026
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export issues to Excel
 # Open in Excel with the update applied

h3. Expected Results

xls is loaded successfully without warning or blank pages.
h3. Actual Results

Excel shows a gray page with update applied.
h3. Workaround
 # Use other xls viewer applications.
 # According to a customer, the security upgrade of Excel has a selected default that prevents the spreadsheet from loading the data. The following steps to uncheck the said default setting described at the attachment below solved 100% the issue for him:
 [^Enable Excel Extracts from JIRA.docx]

*(Please, see attachment)*
fields.summary: Search results exported to Excel result in empty sheets due to Microsoft security update

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# create a group *ldap-group* in LDAP
# connect JIRA to LDAP using Connector type and sync the directory
# add *ldap-group* to a permission in a permission scheme
# in LDAP, rename the group to *ldap-group-renamed*
# sync the directory in JIRA

h4. +Expected behavior+
In the permission scheme, *ldap-group* should become *ldap-group-renamed*

h4. +Actual behavior+
*ldap-group* remains the same in the permission scheme

h4. +Notes+
* *ldap-group* doesn't exist as an Internal (local) group (only in LDAP)
* this might affect other places where *ldap-group* can be used e.g. Issue Security Scheme, Global Permissions, Filter Shares, etc.
fields.summary: Renamed LDAP Group is Not Reflected in Permission Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61889].
  {panel}

Hi
Currently the Pie chart's "Total Issues" under Jira Dashboards by default is set up to order the "Total Issues" according to highest number of issues associated with the particular Status it belongs to e.g.:
Done             11
To Do            10
In Progress    5
on Hold          2

Is it possible to to configure /order the "Total Issues" to be displayed in sequence of the actual workflow statuses. e.g .:
To Do            10
In Progress    5
on Hold          2
Done             11
fields.summary: Option to order Jira pie chart according to the statuses on a specific workflow
XSS in /includes/decorators/global-translations.jsp
Project templates
Add Go Language in Code Block Macro

fields.description:
Current version of Tomcat 8.0.33 is vulernable to http://www.cvedetails.com/cve/CVE-2016-3092/

We need to upgrade the version we package with JIRA to address that vulnerability.
fields.summary: Upgrade Tomcat to 8.0.36 or later

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61884].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when user would like to move a sub-task to another parent task, they will be shown a screen where they can choose recent issues. 
If there's an Epic and Story with the same name, user will not be able to differentiate the Epic and Story because there's no issue icon shown in the selector screen.

 !Screenshot from 2016-07-14 21-25-03.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add icons beside the issue in selector screen so user can differentiate Story and Epic.

h3. Workaround 

User will have to check the issue from Issue Navigator to identify which one of the issue is Epic and which one is Story.
fields.summary: Improve Moving Sub-Task from Parent Task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61883].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It would be great if was possible to trigger a post function based on a workflow trigger for example " Review started - Automatically transitions the issue when a related review is started in Crucible "


h3. Suggested Solution
Allow post functions to be triggered based on workflow triggers.
fields.summary: Post Function based on Workflow Trigger
